name: Camellia
description:
{{nihongo|'''Masaya Oya'''|大箭将也|Ōya Masaya|born September 28, 1992|lead=yes}}, known professionally as {{nihongo|'''Camellia'''|かめりあ|Kameria|lead=yes}}, is a Japanese [[Electronic dance music|electronic]] musician and record producer. He is best known for his work in the [[rhythm game]] scene and has been a composer for games such as ''[[Sound Voltex]]'', ''[[Hatsune Miku: Project Diva]]'' and ''[[Beatmania IIDX]]''. Outside rhythm games, he has worked with the record label [[Pony Canyon]] and is a member of the label [[Exit Tunes]]. He also publishes his discography under his [[independent record label]], KamelCamellia.

Oya began his career with a [[Vocaloid]] sound. After leaving the scene in 2013, he primarily composed fast-paced [[electronic dance music]] (EDM) tracks, often reaching or exceeding 200 [[Tempo|beats per minute]] (BPM). His music encompasses a variety of [[Electronic music|electronic]] styles, including [[j-core]], [[dubstep]], [[Trance music|trance]], [[drum and bass]], [[Hardcore (electronic dance music genre)|hardcore]], [[gabber]], [[Trap music|trap]], [[speedcore]], and [[doujin music|{{tlit|ja|doujin}} music]]. Rather than adhering to a single genre, he is noted for actively experimenting with diverse sounds across his works.

He often collaborates with and has released several albums alongside the singer Nanahira. He has also produced remixes of the ''[[Undertale]]'' original soundtrack (OST) and collaborations with the game designer and composer [[Toby Fox]]. His track "Ghost" gained attention as one of the hardest songs in the VR rhythm game ''[[Beat Saber]]'' at the time of its release. He is popular outside of Japan through the video game ''[[osu!]]'', where he has a dedicated fan community. Oya is also an active [[Video game livestreaming|streamer]] on [[Twitch (service)|Twitch]].
